snippet: The N.S.A. scans every overseas message from America, violating the clear intent of the law.
abstract: Editorial expresses concern about revelations that National Security Agency copies and analyzes virtually all overseas messages sent or received by Americans; contends disclosure makes it more urgent than ever that Congress clamp down on what is unquestionably a bulk collection of American communications that pushes past  protections against invasion of basic privacy.
lead_paragraph: The N.S.A. scans every overseas message from America, violating the clear intent of the law.
